rl.util.exceptions

Class ErrorHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • rl.util.exceptions.ErrorHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleErrorHandler

    public abstract class ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class which defines a standard interface for communicating errors and warnings to the user. The singleton pattern is used to give all parts of the application the chance to inform the user about unexpected events.

    Call getInstance() to access the currently used error handler. Extend this class, implement the abstract interface methods, and provide an instance of the extended class to setInstance(ErrorHandler) to replace the error handler in use.

    Author:
    Ruediger Lunde

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Enables the presentation of low level informations such as stack traces.
      static ErrorHandler getInstance()
      Returns the error handler currently in use.
      abstract void handleError(java.lang.Throwable e)
      Interface method, responsible for communicating recoverable errors to the user.
      abstract void handleFatalError(java.lang.Throwable e)
      Interface method, responsible for communicating unrecoverable errors to the user and terminating the application.
      abstract void handleWarning(java.lang.Throwable warning)
      Interface method, responsible for communicating warnings to the user.
      static void setInstance(ErrorHandler errorHandler)
      Replaces the default error handler.

      • getInstance

        public static ErrorHandler getInstance()
        Returns the error handler currently in use. By default, an instance of SimpleErrorHandler is used.
